bach_open_taxonomy.FeatureFrame.from_data_frame¶

classmethod FeatureFrame.from_data_frame(df, location_stack_column, event_column, overwrite=False, temp_table_name='objectiv_tmp_feature_data')[source]¶

Instantiates a Feature Frame from an original Bach Data Frame. The Bach Data Frame should contain a location stack column and an event column. The database will be queried to create a table with all unique features.

Parameters

  • df (bach.dataframe.DataFrame) – The original Bach DataFrame

  • location_stack_column (str) – The name of the column that contains the location stack.

  • event_column (str) – The name of the column that contains the event type.

  • overwrite (bool) – If True, the temporary table to store the feature data will be overwritten if it exists

  • temp_table_name (str) – The name of the temporary table that will be used to store the feature data.
